existing_features.title: Implement a premium, production-ready mobile-first menu UI for an Indian cafe, matching the requested modern minimalist, warm Indian hospitality aesthetic (inviting, clean, elegant, Instagram-worthy) and avoiding generic template styling.

Apply a single coherent visual theme across the entire site (colors, typography, spacing rhythm, component styling) using warm neutral backgrounds (cream/beige/off-white), high-contrast deep charcoal/black text, and exactly one accent color chosen from the provided options; use #D97706 (saffron orange) as the sole accent color.

Implement typography per spec: import two complementary Google Fonts (one elegant serif for headings; one clean sans-serif for body) and enforce a clear hierarchy for section titles, item names, prices, and descriptions.

Create the menu content structure with these sections as separate pages: Hot Beverages, Cold Beverages, Breakfast & Snacks, Street Food, Main Course, Breads, and Desserts (desserts included). Each section must include at least 3‚Äì4 realistic items with authentic Indian names, vegetarian-friendly majority, and pricing in ‚Çπ30‚Äì‚Çπ400.

Implement the requested menu item card design: circular food images (or circular placeholders), 95‚Äì110px diameter with a 3px border and subtle shadow; a veg/non-veg indicator (small square containing a colored dot) placed at the top-left of the image; generous padding and spacing (30‚Äì40px between items), with subtle dividers by spacing or lines.

Add optional item badges and indicators as specified: "Bestseller", "Chef's Special", and a "Spicy" badge using a üå∂Ô∏è marker; include spice-level indication where relevant without cluttering the card layout.

Build the multi-page ‚Äúdigital book‚Äù interaction: each menu section is a page with horizontal slide transitions between pages; include subtle animations (fade/slide-up) for content on page entry and smooth scrolling within a page.

Provide compact navigation controls that allow users to move between section pages without covering the entire menu (e.g., small next/prev controls and/or a compact pager). Navigation must be usable on small screens and visually minimal.

Use high-quality food photography via direct Unsplash image URLs optimized for fast loading (include width/height and crop params like ?w=400&h=400&fit=crop) while ensuring circular cropping looks good; fall back to a tasteful placeholder when an image is missing.

Add a minimal header and footer consistent with the theme: header includes cafe name + tagline; footer includes a small note like ‚ÄúFreshly made with love‚Äù or ‚ÄúScan to order.‚Äù Keep the header minimal; sticky behavior is optional but must remain unobtrusive if implemented.
Ensure accessibility and mobile quality: semantic structure for headings/sections, readable contrast, no tiny fonts, no horizontal scroll, and motion that respects users who prefer reduced motion.
